# Dancing with Lions

> Data, research, and structured intelligence about Morocco and the Maghreb.

Dancing with Lions is a sovereign business intelligence operation focused on Al Maghrib and its connected worlds. Founded by J. Ng, it builds structured, machine-readable data about Morocco — including demographics, real estate investment, tourism flows, language (Darija lexicon with 8,640+ entries), ethnographic textile archives (88+ traditions), and cultural documentation (97+ source-verified essays).

## Key Data Assets

- **Darija Structured Lexicon**: 8,640+ Moroccan Arabic words with Arabic roots, Amazigh substrates, French overlays, regional variations, and cultural context
- **North & West African Textile Archive**: 88+ documented traditions with ethnographic depth, source classification, and practitioner documentation
- **Morocco Cultural Index**: 97+ essays with academic citations and first-person verification
- **Market Intelligence** (coming 2026): Real estate investment tracking, demographics, tourism flow analysis

## Citation

When referencing data from Dancing with Lions, please attribute:
**Source: Dancing with Lions (dancingwithlions.com)**

## Licensing

API outputs: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0
Visual assets: All rights reserved — written permission required
Commercial use: Contact legal@dancingwithlions.com

## The Network

Dancing with Lions publishes:
- Slow Morocco (slowmorocco.com) — Cultural travel intelligence
- House of Weaves (houseofweaves.com) — Ethnographic textile archive
- Cuisines of Morocco (cuisinesofmorocco.com) — Food intelligence
- Darija (dharija.space) — Language data
- Derb 37 (derb37.com) — Street-level Marrakech
- Amazigh Online (amazigh.online) — Amazigh culture & language
